title: FIR/UAST: commonzie parent conversion
body:
To be updated: first 21 commits are identical to #89 

------

As large portion of declarations/expressions are commonized, its conversion part in the converts becomes redundant. 1st commit commonizes some of them.

2nd commit is a test clean-up which should have been part of https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/pull/4439 (or https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/4ec745abd7402867bfdc4a8c02358d05905ea912#diff-dd044b31a3163343aeaecc85eba263a6282015d77a6dc78c0c2c8aee87bcbb03)

3rd commit commonizes utils to convert parents and reuse them in the base service, instead of plugin-specific service. It requires one more API migration that retrieves annotation attribute value for the given argument.

As shown in the whitelist of `AbstractFirLegacyUastIdentifiersTest`, 80+% of tests can assert that UAST tree generated from leaf-level identifier matches the original UAST tree built in a top-down manner. A few corner cases are remaining, though.

title: FIR/UAST: commonize UAnnotation
body:
To be updated: first 12 commits are identical to #88.

------

Similar to function call expression (#87), annotation requires small steps of adding base service APIs before full commonization.

1st commit is a simple code-level inlining to minimize `ResolvedCall` usage.

From 2nd to 6th commits, the following APIs are added while abstracting frontend-specific conversion/resolution:
* resolution from `KtAnnotationEntry` to annotation class of `PsiClass`
* conversion of value arguments in general (used at annotation attribute mapping)
* retrieval of qualified annotation name (if resolved, of course)
* retrieval of default value (if any) for certain annotation attribute
* to determine if a call is an annotation constructor call (for nested annotation case)

Then, 7th commit finally commonizes `UAnnotation` variants, along with converter changes. 8th commit adds support for conversion of annotated expression.

title: FIR/UAST: commonize enum constant
body:
To be updated: only the last commit is the new addition from #87.

Most of the necessary API additions has been done while commonizing function call expression. It only needs some fixes on FIR IDE HL API: [KOTLIN-CR-144 in Space](https://kotlin.jetbrains.space/p/kotlin/reviews/144/).

title: FIR/UAST: commonize UFunctionCallExpression
body:
`UFunctionCallExpression` is not that trivial due to many diverse points. Therefore, unlike many other commonizations, this task is done step by step.

If a function call target is a constructor, the expression will point to the target class via `UFunctionCallExpression.classReference`. 1st commit commonizes the abstraction of such class reference, along with API addition for resolving target class from `KtCallElement`.

In 2nd commit, simply more places that can use existing base service APIs are rewritten.

3rd commit abstracts `UastCallKind` retrieval from `KtCallElement`.

4th commit simplifies creation of `UFunctionCallExpression` to minimize uses of `ResolvedCall` (from FE 1.0).

5th commit adds API support for receiver type retrieval from `KtCallElement`.

6th commit extracts the name of resolved function call from call expression.

7th commit introduces an API to determine if the call target is an extension.

Finally, there is nothing left in `UFunctionCallExpression` that is specific to certain frontend, except for abstractions for constructor. Interestingly, those are diverged since FIR UAST has not support function call (for delegate constructor call). That means, they can be commonized together. With that, 8th commit commonizes them, along with convert supports in FIR UAST.

Furthermore, `UMethod` for constructors was the only reason `UClass` abstractions were diverged. 9th commit revisits the commonization of `UClass`, and cleans up the mess.

Obviously, as constructor abstractions are unified, `UMethod` itself can be unified too. 10th commit did so. As a result, all the messes left from https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/pull/4455 are gone.
